name: a(n) is the start of the least run of exactly n consecutive positive numbers with strictly decreasing values of A177329, or -1 if no such run exists.
comment: For n > 1, a(n)! is the start the least run of successive factorials with strictly decreasing number of infinitary divisors (A037445).
mathematica: s[n_] := Module[{e = FactorInteger[n!][[;; , 2]]}, Sum[DigitCount[e[[k]], 2, 1], {k, 1, Length[e]}]]; seq[len_] := Module[{v = Table[0, {len}], w = {s[2]}, c = 0, k = 3, m, s1}, While[c < len, s1 = s[k]; m = Length[w]; If[s1 < w[[m]], AppendTo[w, s1], If[m <= len && v[[m]] == 0, v[[m]] = k-m; c++]; w = {s1}]; k++]; v]; seq[5]
program: lista(len) = {my(v = vector(len), w = [s(2)], c = 0, k = 3, m, s1); while(c < len, s1 = s(k); m = #w; if(s1 < w[m], w = concat(w, s1), if(m < = len && v[m] == 0, v[m] = k-m; c++); w = [s1]); k++); v;}
author: _Amiram Eldar_, Jul 16 2024

name: Positive numbers k such that k! and (k+1)! have an equal number of infinitary divisors.
comment: Positive numbers such that k! and (k+1)! have an equal number of Fermi-Dirac factors (A064547).
Positive numbers k such that A037445(k!) = A037445((k+1)!).
Positive numbers k such that A064547(k!) = A064547((k+1)!).
Positive numbers k such that A177329(k) = A177329(k+1).
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: s[n_] := s[n] = Module[{e = FactorInteger[n!][[;; , 2]]}, Sum[DigitCount[e[[k]], 2, 1], {k, 1, Length[e]}]]; Select[Range[2, 400], s[#] == s[# + 1] &]
program: lista(kmax) = {my(s1 = s(1), s2); for(k = 2, kmax, s2 = s(k); if(s1 == s2, print1(k-1, ", ")); s1 = s2);}
author: _Amiram Eldar_, Jul 16 2024

name: Numbers k such that k! has more infinitary divisors than (k+1)!.
comment: Numbers k such that k! has more Fermi-Dirac factors (A064547) than (k+1)!.
Numbers k such that A037445(k!) > A037445((k+1)!).
Numbers k such that A064547(k!) > A064547((k+1)!).
Numbers k such that A177329(k) > A177329(k+1).
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: s[n_] := s[n] = Module[{e = FactorInteger[n!][[;; , 2]]}, Sum[DigitCount[e[[k]], 2, 1], {k, 1, Length[e]}]]; Select[Range[2, 300], s[#] > s[# + 1] &]
program: lista(kmax) = {my(s1 = s(1), s2); for(k = 2, kmax, s2 = s(k); if(s1 > s2, print1(k-1, ", ")); s1 = s2);}
author: _Amiram Eldar_, Jul 16 2024

name: a(n) is the start of the least run of exactly n consecutive positive numbers with an equal value of A177329, or -1 if no such run exists.
comment: For n > 1, a(n)! is the start of the least run of successive factorials of positive numbers (i.e., ignoring 0!) with an equal number of infinitary divisors (A037445).
mathematica: s[n_] := Module[{e = FactorInteger[n!][[;; , 2]]}, Sum[DigitCount[e[[k]], 2, 1], {k, 1, Length[e]}]]; seq[len_] := Module[{v = Table[0, {len}], w = {0}, c = 0, k = 3, m, s1}, While[c < len, s1 = s[k]; m = Length[w]; If[s1 == w[[m]], AppendTo[w, s1], If[m <= len && v[[m]] == 0, v[[m]] = k-m; c++]; w = {s1}]; k++]; v]; seq[5]
program: lista(len) = {my(v = vector(len), w = [0], c = 0, k = 3, m, s1); while(c < len, s1 = s(k); m = #w; if(s1 == w[m], w = concat(w, s1), if(m < = len && v[m] == 0, v[m] = k-m; c++); w = [s1]); k++); v;}
author: _Amiram Eldar_, Jul 16 2024
